pageContext.claim: “According to a survey by the National Small Business Association, the average small business spends $83,000 to comply with regulations in just their first year of existence.”
pageContext.analysis: The survey that Trump is referencing was an online survey among business owners who either belong to the National Small Business Association or had previously provided their email to the group. So it only reflects the opinions of the companies. not an "average." The questions anticipated that the businesses would find regulations "burdensome." Plus, in calculating the average, the association did not weigh the companies differently — the costs for company focused on medical technology  and those for a digital advertising agency are not the same.
